io.cettia.asity.action

Interface Actions<T>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractActions, ConcurrentActions, SimpleActions

    public interface Actions<T>
    A manager for a set of Actions. Inspired by jQuery's Callbacks.

    All operations on an actions are exception-safe.

    Author:
    Donghwan Kim

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Actions.Options
      Options to create an Actions.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Actions<T> add(Action<T> action)
      Adds an action.
      Actions<T> disable()
      Disables any operation on the actions.
      boolean disabled()
      Determines if the actions has been disabled.
      Actions<T> empty()
      Removes all of the actions.
      Actions<T> fire()
      Fire all of the actions.
      Actions<T> fire(T data)
      Fire all of the actions with the given value.
      boolean fired()
      Determines if the actions have been called at least once.
      boolean has()
      Determines if the actions contains an action.
      boolean has(Action<T> action)
      Determines whether the actions contains the specified action.
      Actions<T> remove(Action<T> action)
      Removes an action.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        Actions<T> add(Action<T> action)
        Adds an action.

      • disable

        Actions<T> disable()
        Disables any operation on the actions. This method is useful when multiple events are mutually exclusive.

      • disabled

        boolean disabled()
        Determines if the actions has been disabled.

        Removes all of the actions.

        Fire all of the actions.

        Removes an action.
